comment: Sped through material. Told students to go to a tutor to review tests and find YouTube videos instead of answering problems. Used group work to allow us to teach ourselves instead of teaching. Other classes were allowed a notecard on each test, while he never mentioned them. He graded very late and regularly messed up easy algebraic problems.
He's a great professor, he tells you to study and do the homework to prepare for the quiz. And he goes over it. I would recommend taking his class

Prof. Thornton was okay. He didn't go into a deep explanation of the topics and vaguely answered questions. All hw was on Aleks and there were 3 exams and a final. His teachings were confusing. He didn't give extra credit or allow us to have a notecard for our exams, though other professors allowed it. If you study the class will be easy though.

Prof. Thornton is a helpful and kind teacher. Grades from the ALEKS modules/reports, 3 tests, and a final which replaces your lowest test. If you miss modules, you can do them for up to 75% credit near the end. Open to questions in and out of class. Test grades are fair w/ partial credit. Just do ALEKS and study - he will not make math overly hard.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class
